actions-list.header: On motion to reconsider Roll Call 197

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 580 â€” "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4016) making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2026, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3633) to provide for a system of regulation of the offer and sale of digital commodities by the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1919) to amend the Federal Reserve Act to prohibit the Federal reserve banks from offering certain products or services directly to an individual, to prohibit the use of central bank digital currency for monetary policy, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (S. 1582) to provide for the regulation of payment stablecoins, and for other purposes; and waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules."

The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on motion to reconsider H. Res. 580, and on agreeing to H. Res. 580, if ordered, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed H.R. 1815.
The Chair designated Mr. Fulcher to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 16.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Marlin A. Stutzman to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
